item.ptxt: Use the same procedure for the RH and LH sides.
The procedure listed below is for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: PRECAUTION

atten3.ptxt: After turning the ignition switch off, waiting time may be required before disconnecting the cable from the battery terminal. Therefore, make sure to read the disconnecting the cable from the battery terminal notice before proceeding with work (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT CABLE FROM NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL

atten3.ptxt: When disconnecting the cable, some systems need to be initialized after the cable is reconnected (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE POWER WINDOW REGULATOR MASTER SWITCH ASSEMBLY WITH FRONT DOOR ARMREST BASE PANEL

s2.ptxt: Remove the screw.
Detach the 2 clips and 8 claws.
Disconnect the connector and remove the power window regulator master switch assembly with front door armrest base panel.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR LOWER FRAME BRACKET GARNISH LH

s2.ptxt: Detach the 3 clips and remove the front door lower frame bracket garnish.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR TRIM BOARD SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the screw.
Detach the 9 clips and remove the front door trim board.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR INNER GLASS WEATHERSTRIP LH

s2.ptxt: Raise the 7 claws of the front door inner glass weatherstrip as shown in the illustration, and then remove the front door inner glass weatherstrip from the front door trim board.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT NO. 1 SPEAKER ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the connector.
Put a 5 mm (0.197 in.) drill bit into a drill.
Wind tape around the drill bit approximately 4 mm (0.157 in.) from the tip of the drill as shown in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: Tape the 4 mm (0.157 in.) drill bit to prevent the drill bit from going to deep.

s2.ptxt: Lightly press the drill against the 3 rivets, drill off the flanges of the 3 rivets and remove the front No. 1 speaker assembly.

atten2.ptxt: Be careful of the drilled rivet as it may become hot.

item.ptxt: Pressing the drill too firmly will cause the rivet to turn and result in the rivet not being drilled through.
Do not pry the rivet with the drill because this may cause damage to the installation holes of the rivet or the drill bit.

s2.ptxt: Continue drilling and push out the remaining rivet fragments.
Using a vacuum cleaner, remove the rivet fragments and shavings from the inside of the door.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT NO. 2 SPEAKER ASSEMBLY (w/ Front No. 2 Speaker)

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the connector.
Remove the nut and front No. 2 speaker assembly.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE OUTER REAR VIEW MIRROR ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: w/ Front No. 2 Speaker:

s3.ptxt: Push down the claw and remove the outer rear view mirror assembly LH.

s2.ptxt: w/o Front No. 2 Speaker:

s3.ptxt: Push down the claw and remove the outer rear view mirror assembly LH.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR INSIDE HANDLE SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Detach the claw and 2 guides as indicated by the arrows in the order shown in the illustration.
Disconnect the front door inside locking cable and front door lock remote control cable and remove the front door inside handle.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR NO. 1 TRIM BRACKET

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 screws and front door No. 1 trim bracket.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR SERVICE HOLE COVER LH

s2.ptxt: Pull out the wire harness from the front door service hole cover.
Pull out the front door inside locking cable and front door lock remote control cable from the front door service hole cover, and then remove the front door service hole cover.

atten4.ptxt: Remove any remaining butyl tape from the front door panel.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR GLASS SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Temporarily install the power window regulator master switch assembly with front door armrest base panel.
Connect the cable to the negative (-) battery terminal.
Move the front door glass sub-assembly so that the front door glass bolts can be seen.
Disconnect the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal.

atten3.ptxt: When disconnecting the cable, some systems need to be initialized after the cable is reconnected (See page ).

s2.ptxt: Remove the power window regulator master switch assembly with front door armrest base panel.
Remove the 2 bolts.

atten3.ptxt: After the bolts are removed, do not allow the front door glass to fall.

s2.ptxt: Remove the front door glass as indicated by the arrows in the order shown in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: Do not damage the front door glass.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR BELT MOULDING ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Put protective tape around the front door belt moulding.
Detach the 5 claws and remove the front door belt moulding.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR GLASS RUN LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the front door glass run.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR UPPER OUTER BLACK OUT TAPE LH (w/ Black Out Tape)

atten4.ptxt: When removing the front door upper outer black out tape, heat the front door panel and front door upper outer black out tape using a heat light.

entry.ptxt: Front Door Upper Outer Black Out Tape

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the front door panel or front door upper outer black out tape excessively.

s2.ptxt: Pull back an edge of the front door upper outer black out tape and pull it parallel to the front door panel to remove it.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR REAR OUTER BLACK OUT TAPE LH (w/ Black Out Tape)

atten4.ptxt: When removing the front door rear outer black out tape, heat the front door panel and front door rear outer black out tape using a heat light.

entry.ptxt: Front Door Rear Outer Black Out Tape

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the front door panel or front door rear outer black out tape excessively.

s2.ptxt: Pull back an edge of the front door rear outer black out tape and pull it parallel to the front door panel to remove it.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR WINDOW REGULATOR SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the connector.
Loosen the temporary bolt.

atten3.ptxt: Do not remove the temporary bolt. If the temporary bolt is removed, the front door power window regulator may fall and become damaged.

s2.ptxt: Remove the 5 bolts and front door power window regulator.
Remove the temporary bolt from the front door power window regulator.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE POWER WINDOW REGULATOR MOTOR ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Using a T25 "TORX" socket wrench, remove the 3 screws and power window regulator motor.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR REAR LOWER FRAME SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the bolt.
Detach the guide and remove the front door rear lower frame.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR OUTSIDE HANDLE COVER

s2.ptxt: Remove the hole plug.
Using a T30 "TORX" socket wrench, loosen the screw and remove the front door outside handle cover together with the door key cylinder.
Detach the 2 claws and remove the front door outside handle cover from the door key cylinder.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR LOCK ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the connector.
Disconnect the front door inside locking cable and front door lock remote control cable from the clamps.
Using a T30 "TORX" socket wrench, remove the 3 screws and front door lock.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR LOCK REMOTE CONTROL CABLE ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the front door lock remote control cable.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR INSIDE LOCKING CABLE ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Detach the 3 claws and open the cover.
Remove the front door inside locking cable.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR OUTSIDE HANDLE ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the front door outside handle by sliding and pulling it in the direction indicated by the arrow in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR OUTSIDE HANDLE FRAME SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Using a T30 "TORX" socket wrench, loosen the screw.
Detach the claw and remove the front door outside handle frame.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR LOCK OPEN ROD LH

s2.ptxt: Rotate the snap in the direction indicated by the arrow in the illustration to detach the snap from the front door lock open rod.
Remove the front door lock open rod from the front door outside handle frame.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR FRONT OUTSIDE HANDLE PAD

s2.ptxt: Detach the 2 claws and remove the front door front outside handle pad.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR REAR OUTSIDE HANDLE PAD

s2.ptxt: Detach the 2 claws and remove the front door rear outside handle pad.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR PANEL CUSHION

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 front door panel cushions.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR WEATHERSTRIP LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the double-sided tape to detach the 17 clips and remove the front door weatherstrip.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR OUTSIDE MOULDING LH (w/ Outside Moulding)

atten4.ptxt: When removing the front door outside moulding, heat the front door panel and front door outside moulding using a heat light.

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the front door panel or front door outside moulding excessively.

s2.ptxt: Put protective tape around the front door outside moulding.
Insert piano wire between the front door panel and front door outside moulding.
Tie objects that can serve as handles (for example, wooden blocks) to the piano wire ends.
Pull the piano wire and scrape off the double-sided tape that holds the front door outside moulding to the front door panel.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the front door panel.

s2.ptxt: Remove the front door outside moulding.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT DOOR CHECK ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the 3 bolts and front door check.
